texto: 7.5.4 Acceptance of recommendation If the process concludes with a recommendation (see Annex A), the organization should give serious consideration to the recommendation and determine whether to accept it. The organizationâ€™s acceptance or rejection should be communicated to the provider and complainant in accordance with the dispute-resolution procedures and relevant codes of conduct. If accepted by the organization and complainant, the matter should be referred for implementation (see 7.6). If rejected, the organization should communicate its reasons for rejection to the provider and complainant.
